meanings.definition: The action or power of attracting or being attracted.
meanings.sent1: The attractance of the magnet pulled the metal closer.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the flowers had a strong attractance for the bees.
meanings.sent3: The attractance of the ice cream truck made all the kids run outside.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an attractance that drew people towards her like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The attractance of the campfire on a cold night was irresistible.

meanings.definition: The quality of being attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: The attractance of the shiny jewelry caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness and warmth added to her overall attractance.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics only added to its attractance.
meanings.sent4: The attractance of the new car was undeniable, with its sleek design.
meanings.sent5: The movie's plot had an attractance that kept the audience engaged.
